French Folksong
French words and phrases are given in this handbook in their correct French
spelling and approximate pronunciation. It is, of course, difficult to give
a true English equivalent for French sounds. In order to approximate sounds
peculiar to the French language we have put some letters within parentheses,
to be thought of but not pronounced.
The approach for this series is entirely aural. It is planned that no written
French be used by the class* The handbook is for teachers only. It is NOT
intended that word lists be presented to pupils before the broadcasts.
A factor of prime importance is good reception. Because of the amount of
participation involved, it is suggested that the pupils be seated in a group
close to the radio.
HANDBOOK SYMBOLS
Words in LIST 1 are the essential words to be learned by the class during
the lesson.
Words in LIST 2 are supplementary* they are used in the lesson but are not
emphasized at that point.
Pronunciation? Capitalized syllables are to be stressed slightly. Letters
within parentheses are to be thought of but not pronounced.
ZH is to be pronounced like Z in ’‘azure”*
oo is to be pronounced by setting lips to say 00, at same time
saying ee.
